jpacman.controller
Class ImageFactory

java.lang.Object
  jpacman.controller.ImageFactory

public class ImageFactory
extends java.lang.Object

The responsibilities of this class include obtaining images from file, that can be used for animations of the player and the monsters in Pacman.

Version:
$Id: ImageFactory.java,v 1.11 2009/01/28 20:01:21 arie Exp $
Author:
Arie van Deursen, Delft University of Technology, May 2007

Constructor Detail

ImageFactory

public ImageFactory()
Create an empty (non intialized) image factory.

Method Detail

loadImages

public void loadImages()
                throws java.io.IOException
Read images for player and monsters from file. Different images exist for different phases of the animation.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the images can't be found.

monsterAnimationCount

public int monsterAnimationCount()
Returns:
Number of different monster animation steps

playerAnimationCount

public int playerAnimationCount()
Returns:
Number of different player animation steps

intialized

public boolean intialized()
Invariant that may be a bit expensive to compute all the time, so it is selectively invoked.

Returns:
true iff invariant holds and all images are non-null.

player

public java.awt.Image player(int dx,
                             int dy,
                             int anim)
Get a player in (pizza slice) in the appropriate direction at the given animation sequence. TODO: refactor this so that enums are used -- will be cleaner, and will resolve the checkstyle warning.

Parameters:
dx - x direction
dy - y direction
anim - Animation step
Returns:
Player image in appropriate direction.

monster

public java.awt.Image monster(int animationIndex)
Obtain a picture of a monster.

Parameters:
animationIndex - counter indicating which animation to use.
Returns:
The monster image at the given animation index.
